intro: Oxydectes velloziana, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch. It produces showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Oxydectes velloziana is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in some regions.
